column2: 11.1.1. The following pages contain quick reference guides for the main timing structures in the game. When initiating a new timing structure, begin at the first numbered step and proceed through the structure sequentially, unless instructed to move to a different phase or step.
11.1.2. These guides are intended to serve as shorthand references only; for comprehensive rules relating to each timing structure, see the accompanying rules sections.
11.2. Timing Structure of The Corp's Turn ({ref:Sec_steps_corp_turn})
11.2.1.2.2. Does the Corp have unspent clicks?
11.2.1.2.2.2. If yes, the Corp takes an action.
11.2.1.3.5. The Corp's turn is complete, and the game moves to the Runner's turn.
11.3. Timing Structure of The Runner's Turn ({ref:Sec_steps_runner_turn})
11.3.1.1.6. Does the Runner have unspent clicks?
11.3.1.1.6.2. If yes, the Runner takes an action.
11.3.1.2.5. The Runner's turn is complete, and the game moves to the Corp's turn.
11.4.1.1.1. The Runner announces the attacked server.
11.4.1.1.2. The Runner gains bad publicity credits.
11.4.1.1.4. The Runner's position is set to the outermost ice, if any.
11.4.1.1.6. Does the Runner have a position corresponding to a piece of ice?
11.4.1.2.2. Paid ability window: (P) (R) and ice can be rezzed.
11.4.1.3.2. Paid ability window: (P) and subroutines can be broken.
11.4.1.3.3. Are there unbroken subroutines to resolve?
11.4.1.3.3.1. If yes, the Corp resolves the next one.
11.4.1.4.1. If the run got here from (2) or (3), the Runner passes ice.
11.4.1.4.4. The Runner moves 1 position inward, if possible.
11.4.1.4.6. Did the Runner move to a new position?
11.4.1.5.2. The Runner breaches the attacked server.
11.4.1.6.1. Close or resolve priority windows from before "end the run".
11.4.1.6.2. The Runner loses unspent bad publicity credits.
11.4.1.6.3. If applicable, the run is declared unsuccessful.
11.5. Timing Structure of Breaching a Server ({ref:Sec_breaching_steps})
11.5.1.2. If breaching Archives, facedown cards in Archives are turned faceup.
11.5.1.3. If breaching HQ or R&D, determine how many accesses from Corp's hand or deck.
11.5.1.4. Are there candidate cards remaining to access?
11.5.1.4.1. If yes, the Runner chooses a candidate.
11.5.1.5. The Runner accesses the chosen card.
11.6. Timing Structure of Accessing a Card ({ref:Sec_steps_accessing_card})
11.6.1.2. The Runner may trash the card or use another mid-access ability.
11.6.1.3. If the card is an agenda, the Runner steals it.
